reviews.title: Genuine country hospitality
reviews.text: A small and historic hotel with an excellent reputation for food - the locals were flocking in for dinner when we were there. Very friendly hosts, keen to make our stay enjoyable. 17th century ambiance included creaky floors and a rather firm bed, but all other facilities were A1, especially the full (very full!) English breakfast.

A group of six of us came here for lunch. The place was very quiet with I think only one or two other tables occupied . We were the only diners in our room. Service was incredibly slow considering ! .Yes, we wanted a leisurely lunch but this was ridiculous. We waited 15 mins to have our order taken, Only two starters were ordered and these were another 30 mins . We eventually tucked into our mains an hour and 20 mins after arriving !
reviews.title: could do better !

reviews.text: The food was ok . I had the duck breast which was overdone and not very hot ,the other meals were equally underwhelming,though nicely presented and nicely cooked veg,apart from some mashed potato !
reviews.title: a fine dinner

reviews.text: As it was a midweek lunchtime maybe the usual chef was not there ,which might account for peoples varied reviews here.Sorry but it was not good enough to make me want to return.
reviews.title: I bow to no one in my regard for this establishment and its proprietors.

reviews.text: A favourite local place chosen for a family gathering - we were made very welcome, given most delicious food,all freshly made and with unusual South African dishes available from the charming chef/co-owners homeland,served with a smile and the bonus of some uncommon and reasonably priced wine.we love this place and thank Mr & Mrs Walker for a memorable birthday dinner
reviews.title: Tasty, well presented, good value, food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here last summer while visiting the Stanbrook Nuns at their new Abbey, just up the hill - the Mother Abbess had recommended it and I was not disappointed. I was warmly received by the proprietor from the bus from York, which dropped me at the door. My room was spotless, best cotton sheets, and very comfortable with an excellent though compact bathroom. My breakfast was perfect in every respect (now that's not easy) and when I found that I had lost a button from my shirt and asked for needle and cotton, the lady of the house very kindly insisted on sewing it on for me! A friend and I had Sunday lunch outside in the courtyard - which rated ten out of ten for us both - served by a most courteous local lad who had clearly been trained to the highest standards. I am a well travelled person - due to my business - and lucky enough to be used to staying in the best hotels around the world. I will remember my stay at the Wombell Arms far longer than I will remember many of those and hope to return some day.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.text: I visited this pub/restaurant with my husband and 2 children ages 12 and 4.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: We had a wonderful meal, between us we had starters of garlic bread and fishcakes, my young son had the childrens menu of fishfingers ( home made ) and chips (home made), Paella,Beef and burger (homemade with ciabatta bread were all outstanding. We then has chocolate brownies for pudding with ice cream which was probably the best dessert i have ever had, home made truffles and coffee.
reviews.title: just fantastic! everything was wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Overnight travel stop

reviews.text: Staff/owners were very friendly and helpful
reviews.title: new owners - not the same

reviews.text: I had a wonderful stay in beautiful very clean and newly very tastefully redecorated rooms. the food is truly fantastic and is reasonably priced compared to other pubs in the area.
reviews.title: very poor
